item.title: [SUZLON] Suzlon Energy Faces Rs.9.60 Crores Penalty from Principal Commissioner of Customs, Chennai
item.description:
Suzlon Energy Ltd. has received an order from the Principal Commissioner of Customs, Chennai, imposing a penalty of Rs.9.60 Crores on Suzlon Global Services Limited, which has since been merged with Suzlon Energy Limited. The penalty is due to an alleged short payment of IGST. The company plans to appeal the decision. This update is in accordance with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.

  • Suzlon Energy Ltd. has been levied a penalty of Rs.9.60 Crores by the Principal Commissioner of Customs, Chennai.
  • The penalty is a result of an alleged short payment of IGST by Suzlon Global Services Limited.
  • Suzlon Global Services Limited has since been merged with Suzlon Energy Limited.
  • The company plans to appeal the decision.

item.title: [NOVARTIND] Acquirers Announce Open Offer for 26% Stake in Novartis India Ltd at INR 860.64 Per Share
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Axis Capital Limited has submitted a public announcement for an open offer to acquire up to 64,19,608 fully paid-up equity shares of Novartis India Ltd, representing 26% of the voting share capital, at a price of INR 860.64 per share. The acquirers are WaveRise Investments Limited, ChrysCapital Fund X, and Two Infinity Partners. The offer is being made in compliance with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations, 2011. The offer price is determined in accordance with Regulations 8(1) and 8(2) of the SEBI (SAST) Regulations and may be revised. The offer is a triggered offer and not subject to any minimum level of acceptance or a competing offer.

item.title: [NOVARTIND] Novartis AG to Sell 70.68% Stake in Novartis India Ltd to WaveRise Investments, ChrysCapital and Two Infinity Partners
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Novartis AG, the promoter of Novartis India Ltd, has entered into an agreement to sell 1,74,50,680 fully paid-up equity shares, representing 70.68% of the paid-up equity share capital, to WaveRise Investments Limited, ChrysCapital Fund X and Two Infinity Partners. The transaction is expected to be completed by February 19, 2026. Post-completion, Novartis AG will cease to be a 'Promoter' of the company, and the acquirers will acquire control and be classified as the 'Promoter'. The company has agreed to comply with certain customary interim obligations and post-closing obligations.

  • Novartis AG to sell 70.68% stake in Novartis India Ltd to WaveRise Investments, ChrysCapital and Two Infinity Partners
  • Transaction value not disclosed
